location.formatted: 1, Vasant Vihar, Uppal, Secunderabad, Telangana 500068, India

sections.text: CAREER OBJECTIVE To pursue a highly rewarding career, seeking for a job in a challenging and healthy work environment where I can utilize my communication skills and application knowledge efficiently for organizational growth.

EXPERIENCE: MAY 2022- PRESENT MYMONEYKARMA INFORMATICS PRIVATE LTD • TALENT ACQUISITION AND SOURCING SPECIALIST. MARCH 2021 CLARK & KENT- TALENT ACQUISITION AND EXECUTIVE RESEARCH SPECIALIST • Passionate and organized Talent Acquisition Specialist, with excellent communication and problem solving skills. Detail oriented Research Specialist. Have filled in Executive/Leadership positions at Aditya Birla, ZippMat, Sela & MRK Nulife. . JUNE 2020 Freelance content writer for a leading lifestyle magazine based out of Hyderabad. AUGUST 2019- MARCH 2020 Global University Systems (SALES ADVISOR FOR UNIVERSITY CANADA WEST, VANCOUVER) • Advising my team of 12 associates with extracting data from Google Ads and other search engines, to increase the company's organic search traffic by 80% • Approaching the leads to generate income, which is the Initial Deposit a lead has to make, of $8000 CAD, to join in UCW. • GUS has by far generated CAD 70,000$ with my assistance. • Monitoring and coaching the subordinates validating their work according to the

standard operating procedure. 2018 – 2019 SR ASSOCIATE, NA/UK, (PREMIUM TEAM) PARTNER OPERATIONS • Communication and Coordination with internal teams and sellers. • Maintained end to end ownership of every seller interaction coupled with proactive problem solving and provided exceptional support to sellers. • Troubleshooting issues using multiple systems and tools. • Providing prompt and efficient service to Amazon Sellers and Merchants including the appropriate escalation of Sellers' issues. • Actively sought solutions through logical reasoning and data interpretation skills and identifies trends to appropriate channel including improvement suggestions. • Liaise with other departments such as Customer Service, Merchant Investigations, or Payments teams as required to resolve Seller's issues and questions. • Been part of the employee engagement team. • Met or exceeded metric expectations. • Mentored new hires and helped them overcome knowledge gaps. • Rewarded for consistent performance across various quarters. • Handled internal audits through data analysis with the help of excel. 2017 – 2018 TRANSPORTATION SPECIALIST, (PREMIUM TEAM) ,AMAZON NOC, LEVEL 3 • Communication with external customers (Carriers, Vendors/Suppliers) and internal customers (Retail, Finance, Software Support, Fulfillment Centers) • Generating the required number of routes and allocation of packages to ensure hassle free, timely pick-up and delivery of freight from vendors to Amazon fulfillment centers (FC) and from Amazon FCs to carrier hubs. • Tactical problem solving along with understanding trends in network exceptions and then automating processes or proposing process changes to streamline operations. • Network monitoring and significant analysis of network data. • Extracting from numerous databases (using Excel, Access, SQL and/or other data management systems) • Monitoring and coaching the subordinates validating their work according to the standard operating procedure. • Training the new hires and helping them cope with the evolving process. • Developing performance metrics to assist with driving business results. • Ability to scope out business and functional requirements for the Amazon technology teams who create and enhance the software systems and tools that are used by TOC. • Understanding the business impact of the trends and making decisions that make sense based on available data. • Handling escalations and callouts from the station teams and escalating problems or variance in the information and data to the relevant owners and teams and following through on the resolutions to ensure they are delivered. • Providing real-time customer experience by working in 24*7 operating environment.

• Creating a narrative outlining weekly findings and the variances to goals, and present these findings in a review forum. 2016 JULY – 2016 NOVEMBER AMAZON SSP ASSOCIATE: • Handled partner queries during peak season. • Won multiple awards for good performance • Maintained metric expectations • Managed ambiguity and new situations where standard operating procedures may not exist. • Demonstrated ownership and problem solving to resolve challenging customer issues, escalating when necessary.

EDUCATION 2016-2017 PG Diploma in Computer Applications {DCA} - Certified 2013– 2016 B.A, MASS COMMUNICATION AND JOURNALISM, ST FRANCIS COLLEGE FOR WOMEN - GPA 7.7 2011- 2013 INTERMEDIATE, NARAYANA EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS GPA 7.1 2005 - 2010 CLASS X, KENDRIYA VIDHYALAYA, NO.1UPPAL , CGPA 7.0

PERSONAL TRAITS • Strong morals and ethics ensure honesty, reliability and ability to undertake tasks responsibly. • Articulate communicator with appreciation for different communication styles required when working with other team members or • Understanding the need to remain flexible to support last-minute demands and changes. Comfortable in changing environments and situations, ensuring ability.

PERSONAL INFORMATION • Date of Birth : 25th December 1994 • Sex : Female • Marital Status : Married • Linguistic abilities : English, Hindi and Telugu • Nationality : Indian • Interests : Reading Books, Writing Movie Reviews, Book Reviews, Articles

workExperience.jobDescription:
Advising my team of 12 associates with extracting data from Google Ads and other search engines, to increase the company's organic search traffic by 80% 
•Approaching the leads to generate income, which is the Initial Deposit a lead has to make, of $8000 CAD, to join in UCW. 
•GUS has by far generated CAD 70,000$ with my assistance. 
•Monitoring and coaching the subordinates validating their work according to the standard operating procedure.

Communication and Coordination with internal teams and sellers. 
•Maintained end to end ownership of every seller interaction coupled with proactive problem solving and provided exceptional support to sellers. 
•Troubleshooting issues using multiple systems and tools. 
•Providing prompt and efficient service to Amazon Sellers and Merchants including the appropriate escalation of Sellers' issues. 
•Actively sought solutions through logical reasoning and data interpretation skills and identifies trends to appropriate channel including improvement suggestions. 
•Liaise with other departments such as Customer Service, Merchant Investigations, or Payments teams as required to resolve Seller's issues and questions. 
•Been part of the employee engagement team. 
•Met or exceeded metric expectations. 
•Mentored new hires and helped them overcome knowledge gaps. 
•Rewarded for consistent performance across various quarters. 
•Handled internal audits through data analysis with the help of excel.

classification.title: IT user support technicians
classification.subMajorGroup: SCIENCE, ENGINEERING AND TECHNOLOGY ASSOCIATE PROFESSIONALS

workExperience.jobDescription:
NOC, LEVEL 3 
•Communication with external customers (Carriers, Vendors/Suppliers) and internal customers (Retail, Finance, Software Support, Fulfillment Centers) 
•Generating the required number of routes and allocation of packages to ensure hassle free, timely pick-up and delivery of freight from vendors to Amazon fulfillment centers (FC) and from Amazon FCs to carrier hubs. 
•Tactical problem solving along with understanding trends in network exceptions and then automating processes or proposing process changes to streamline operations. 
•Network monitoring and significant analysis of network data. 
•Extracting from numerous databases (using Excel, Access, SQL and/or other data management systems) 
•Monitoring and coaching the subordinates validating their work according to the standard operating procedure. 
•Training the new hires and helping them cope with the evolving process. 
•Developing performance metrics to assist with driving business results. 
•Ability to scope out business and functional requirements for the Amazon technology teams who create and enhance the software systems and tools that are used by TOC. 
•Understanding the business impact of the trends and making decisions that make sense based on available data. 
•Handling escalations and callouts from the station teams and escalating problems or variance in the information and data to the relevant owners and teams and following through on the resolutions to ensure they are delivered. 
•Providing real-time customer experience by working in 24*7 operating environment. 
•Creating a narrative outlining weekly findings and the variances to goals, and present these findings in a review forum.

Handled partner queries during peak season. 
•Won multiple awards for good performance 
•Maintained metric expectations 
•Managed ambiguity and new situations where standard operating procedures may not exist. 
•Demonstrated ownership and problem solving to resolve challenging customer issues, escalating when necessary.
